title: babo
author: babo
content: we can start the speculations and what will be our favorite teams for next seasonobviously Guardiola's team played impressively, barring twists and turns, they remain one of the favorites alongside Real Madrid of courseWhat do you think about it?----the thread will be updated and closed after the end of UCL of course----Manchester City is the last winner of the cup.UEFA Champions League is the first cup of Europe. After Europa League and Conference League.There are 80 teams total, 32 in group stage in 8 group.Wikipedia https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/UEFA_Champions_League

comments.author: Oshosondy
comments.body: Is it not too early to be discussing about 2023/2024 UEFA Champions League? We are heading to pre-season which should be what we supposed to be discussing about for now. I mean pre-matches and transfers.Quote from: babo on June 12, 2023, 10:23:11 AMUEFA Champions League is the first cup of Europe. After Europa League and Conferences League.Why include Europa League and Europa conference League together? Conference League was founded in just 2 years ago in 2021.

comments.author: Queentoshi
comments.body: Quote from: babo on June 12, 2023, 10:23:11 AMwe can start the speculations and what will be our favorite teams for next seasonobviously Guardiola's team played impressively, barring twists and turns, they remain one of the favorites alongside Real Madrid of courseWhat do you think about it?Guardiola's side remain the favourites to win it again. Real Madrid is still very consistent, but I do not think we should underate Manchester United too. In just this their first season with a new coach, they were able to win one competition and came second in another. Manchester United will get players were they need to and next season with this their present coach, they can win the champions league and even the premier league. They are not new to winning the competition as a club, so they are also one of the competitions title contenders next season.

comments.author: el kaka22
comments.body: I do agree that it's too early to discuss it, but not like we are going to see any different teams fighting for it neither. I still say the same four big names and sometimes they will be a bit worse and sometimes they can be better but it will always be like this to me; City and Madrid as the best teams, even when Madrid lost Benzema, I still keep them at the top because this is their cup, they love to win it.After those two, we have PSG and Bayern, one is the greatest team at Bundesliga and the other at ligue 1, so it's not going to be easy to beat City and Madrid, but it's possible. After these four there are like a dozen teams that can be good, but I seriously expect these four to fight for it, and I can say this without even seeing a single transfer, it's like that every year anyway.

comments.author: Daniel91
comments.body: In order to be able to have a quality and reasoned discussion about the favorites in the next season of the Champions League, they should first see how all the clubs will look in the new season and with which players they will play.Until then, we can only discuss in general, but actually every season the favorites are always the same, right? We always talk about more or less the same clubs, Manchester City, Real, Barcelona, PSG and Bayern, and this season we will probably be able to add Arsenal, Napoli and Inter to the list.The first league of champions is always the most difficult to win and that's why it will be much easier for Manchester City players now and they will play with much less pressure and that's why I consider them the main favorites for the new title.

After these four there are like a dozen teams that can be good, but I seriously expect these four to fight for it, and I can say this without even seeing a single transfer, it's like that every year anyway.Nowadays, I believe that football has become a little more unpredictable than it used to be. I would say that it is at least more unpredictable than it was in the past. I have always considered Real Madrid to be one of the best teams in the Champions League. Manchester City is also showing good form. Due to the fact that Manchester City is the current defending Champions League title holder right now, it is safe to say that they are the best team. Honestly, I don't think that PSG is even close to their level, as far as I'm concerned. And if we talk about Barcelona I have to say that the Barcelona we have right now is not on track to win the Champions League.

comments.author: Fivestar4everMVP
comments.body: I join my voice with those saying it's too early to also say that it's rather too early to start discussing about the eufa champions league for the 2023/2024 season, there are no information of any kind about the game formation available yet, and neither is there any Information on when exactly the tournament will begin, so what exactly are we to be discussing about?In the end, peeps are still going to continue discussing the happenings In the just concluded season, rather than topics relating to the coming season..

comments.author: Velvet78
comments.body: Real Madrid must have found out how bad they were against Manchester City. They will really need to make a big improvement for next season. They need to stay strong in offense and defense both. Manchester City just tore their defense apart in the second leg. Now Benzema has left the team people are wondering who will be filling his space in the team.Real Madrid should make their investment in the right way to become much more competitive in the Champions League again. They can actually make some adjustments in the defense line as well. Because I found the defenders quite desperate against Manchester City attackers.

comments.author: JooBra
comments.body: We can't say much at this point but I'm pretty sure that City won't win it again. They need 1 bad game in knockout stage and they will be out. Going 2years without bad game it's really hard and City does not have legacy of Real M to do that.

They are already focusing on some good signing in the next transfer market. They are choosing some great players for their number 9. Also there will be some more effective transfers and that will make Real Madrid a Promising team for the next season.

comments.author: bitbollo
comments.body: I also think it's a bit too early to start talking about it, also because the transfer market has to take place and some nations could place additional teams on the list.For sure the winner take always the spot for the next year... let's see how it proceed but anyway it's always "a long battle" up to the finale...

There are so many teams in Europe that would have won the finals if they had the opportunities that Inter Milan had. I am sure that Napoli's Victor Osimhen and his teammates will not waste the chances that Martinez and Lukaku lost.

comments.author: Doell
comments.body: Manchester City got their first trophy this season, maybe they still have a chance to be the favorites team again in next season, if there are no changes in their squad. But I think they can certainly reach the top 8 or even semi-finals, but also to win again I think it's too early because there are many big clubs who have pocketed tickets for next season. We can't underestimate them either especially Inter, although they unlucky this season but they can reach to the finals, it's a sign of how strong they are this season and maybe next season they can showing more optimal.

comments.body: Quote from: Velvet78 on June 12, 2023, 07:33:19 PMReal Madrid must have found out how bad they were against Manchester City. After Man City eliminated them in the semi-final round, Real Madrid already evaluated their squad. There are only 2 attackers on Real Madrid squad (Vinicius and Rodrygo), Real Madrid needs some attackers to replace those players who left the club. The main target should be a new center forward (CF), a new striker who can replace Benzema's position. There is a rumor that Real Madrid is trying to sign Harry Kane, but it looks like not easy for Real Madrid to negotiate with Tottenham.Well, Real Madrid defense line is also not strong enough. They need some new defenders, especially for left and right backs. They also need 1 strong center back at least. I hope Real Madrid will consider putting Nacho Fernández and Jesús Vallejo on the transfer list.

comments.author: Mr.right85
comments.body: I take it that, given the opportunity of a locked previous thread on this subject and the closure of the league, starting a unique thread that would span many discussions for a long time is something most of us would like but, like it's been said by some already,Quote from: Oshosondy on June 12, 2023, 10:51:22 AMIs it not too early to be discussing about 2023/2024 UEFA Champions League? We are heading to pre-season which should be what we supposed to be discussing about for now. I mean pre-matches and transfers.I go with the rest of users here that says, it's way too early. The previous season just ended 2days ago with Manchester City emerging as the 2022/23 champions and would be title defenders through the 2023/24 season but at this time, a lot is unclear and having to speculate anything would be doing it without several statistics to go by. The transfers aren't done and the teams strength can't be qualified. It's just too early.
